page.title: 12VICTORY HALL MOBBERLEY
page.content: The Victory Hall was built to celebrate the victory of the Allies in the First World War and cost Â£4500. The money was raised by public subscription, sales of work and entertainments. The land was given by Mr. R.O.Leycester. The Hall has a wooden frame and walls, with a tiled roof. It has been extended over the years and now houses the working Men's Club which has a membership of 400. The Club has a bar, and snooker,darts and bowls are among the games played. The Victory Hall is the centre of social life in Mobberley and provides facilities for dances, social events, Churchwomen's Fellowship, Parish meetings and a playgroup. The Hall is managed by a committee which, comprises members of local organisations.
